problem_text:
Suppose that G is an algebraic group, H is a closed normal subgroup of G and f : G → G/H is the canonical homomorphism. What conditions ensure that there exists a rational section s: G/H → G such that sf = 1? For partial results, see (Yu. I. Merzlyakov, Rational Groups, Nauka, Moscow, 1987, § 37 (Russian)).
Yu. I. Merzlyakov
